intro: Phyllanthus kidna, commonly known as the African butterbean plant, is a flowering plant species native to Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with simple, opposite leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
